Restricted the Travis builds to some branches only

We don't want Travis to build feature branches created in the main repos, as these feature branches will always have a PR which is built as well.
Travis will now run builds only for the master branch and for branches named "x.y" where x and y are numbers (to let us create maintenance branches for releases if needed), and for pull requests sent to these branches.

Jérôme Vieilledent.message:
Fix Host header for proxy client requests

When using `ban` requests with Varnish proxy client, requests are queued
and sent with `flush()`. Queued requests are registered without host,
making Guzzle create an empty `Host` header.

When flushing, Guzzle request is re-created starting
with the original one (so without host), with all registered headers.
The problem is that the empty `Host` header is also copied, and thus not
re-created by Guzzle with the server URL. In the backend, cURL sees it
and takes it into account, overriding passed URL silently.

This causes requests with empty host being fired by Guzzle, which is
kind of annoying :smiley:.

Simplify hits counting

With Varnish 4.0, the simple obj.hits stopped working and we had to
resort to counting the number of spaces in X-Varnish. At least from
Varnish 4.0.3 onwards, obj.hits works as it did in Varnish 3.
Test against PHP 7.1

* Make VCL compatible with Varnish 5.
* Move Varnish 4/5 files to varnish.
* Keep varnish-3 for now.
* Upgrade Travis config to Trusty/edge to get rid of
   /usr/lib/varnish/libvarnish.so: undefined symbol: pcre_free_study
* Update documentation.
* Update changelog.

Christophe Coevoet.message:
Fix the upload of the code coverage to Scrutinizer

PHP 7 and HHVM are not able to generate code coverage on Travis. If
ocular is called in this case, it will report to Scrutinizer that the
code coverage has not been collected, which will cancel the scrutinizer
analysis if it is the first Travis job to finish (which is likely as
generating code coverage would slow down the other jobs).

Restricted the Travis builds to some branches only

We don't want Travis to build feature branches created in the main repos, as these feature branches will always have a PR which is built as well.
Travis will now run builds only for the master branch and for branches named "x.y" where x and y are numbers (to let us create maintenance branches for releases if needed), and for pull requests sent to these branches.

Jérôme Vieilledent.message:
Fix Host header for proxy client requests

When using `ban` requests with Varnish proxy client, requests are queued
and sent with `flush()`. Queued requests are registered without host,
making Guzzle create an empty `Host` header.

When flushing, Guzzle request is re-created starting
with the original one (so without host), with all registered headers.
The problem is that the empty `Host` header is also copied, and thus not
re-created by Guzzle with the server URL. In the backend, cURL sees it
and takes it into account, overriding passed URL silently.

This causes requests with empty host being fired by Guzzle, which is
kind of annoying :smiley:.

Christophe Coevoet.message:
Fix the upload of the code coverage to Scrutinizer

PHP 7 and HHVM are not able to generate code coverage on Travis. If
ocular is called in this case, it will report to Scrutinizer that the
code coverage has not been collected, which will cancel the scrutinizer
analysis if it is the first Travis job to finish (which is likely as
generating code coverage would slow down the other jobs).
Use the HttpFoundation API to read the header in the test kernel

Merge pull request #91 from FriendsOfSymfony/purge-clarification

Restricted the Travis builds to some branches only

We don't want Travis to build feature branches created in the main repos, as these feature branches will always have a PR which is built as well.
Travis will now run builds only for the master branch and for branches named "x.y" where x and y are numbers (to let us create maintenance branches for releases if needed), and for pull requests sent to these branches.

Jérôme Vieilledent.message:
Fix Host header for proxy client requests

When using `ban` requests with Varnish proxy client, requests are queued
and sent with `flush()`. Queued requests are registered without host,
making Guzzle create an empty `Host` header.

When flushing, Guzzle request is re-created starting
with the original one (so without host), with all registered headers.
The problem is that the empty `Host` header is also copied, and thus not
re-created by Guzzle with the server URL. In the backend, cURL sees it
and takes it into account, overriding passed URL silently.

This causes requests with empty host being fired by Guzzle, which is
kind of annoying :smiley:.

Gavin Staniforth.message:
adds a noop client which implements all interfaces but … (#289)

adds a noop client which implements all interfaces but does nothing

this client is useful to keep applications that invalidate cache simple during development / testing. they can be configured with the noop client and send invalidation requests without a caching proxy existing.

jnonon.message: Fixed bug that allows override necessary options

Changes:

* Added missing typehint
* Added return values when cUrl errors occurs
* Modified composer definition

Changes:

* Removed DependencyNotMetException in favor of RuntimeException
* Varnish helper now uses a single curl handler per request.
Fixed code conventions

David de Boer.message: Raise minimum-stability to stable

Remove Interface suffix and rename proxy client interfaces

* Apply fixes from StyleCI (#337)
* Update changelog
Add sendRequest method to test client
Fix PHPDoc type hint
Fix libjemalloc1 build failure (#334)
Merge branch '1.4'
Prepare release 2.0.0 (#329)
Update links to ReadtheDocs
Fix spelling errors
Fix some small documentation issues

Simplify hits counting

With Varnish 4.0, the simple obj.hits stopped working and we had to
resort to counting the number of spaces in X-Varnish. At least from
Varnish 4.0.3 onwards, obj.hits works as it did in Varnish 3.
Test against PHP 7.1

Add Varnish 5 compatibility

* Make VCL compatible with Varnish 5.
* Move Varnish 4/5 files to varnish.
* Keep varnish-3 for now.
* Upgrade Travis config to Trusty/edge to get rid of
   /usr/lib/varnish/libvarnish.so: undefined symbol: pcre_free_study
* Update documentation.
* Update changelog.

Christophe Coevoet.message:
Fix the upload of the code coverage to Scrutinizer

PHP 7 and HHVM are not able to generate code coverage on Travis. If
ocular is called in this case, it will report to Scrutinizer that the
code coverage has not been collected, which will cancel the scrutinizer
analysis if it is the first Travis job to finish (which is likely as
generating code coverage would slow down the other jobs).

Restricted the Travis builds to some branches only

We don't want Travis to build feature branches created in the main repos, as these feature branches will always have a PR which is built as well.
Travis will now run builds only for the master branch and for branches named "x.y" where x and y are numbers (to let us create maintenance branches for releases if needed), and for pull requests sent to these branches.

Jérôme Vieilledent.message:
Fix Host header for proxy client requests

When using `ban` requests with Varnish proxy client, requests are queued
and sent with `flush()`. Queued requests are registered without host,
making Guzzle create an empty `Host` header.

When flushing, Guzzle request is re-created starting
with the original one (so without host), with all registered headers.
The problem is that the empty `Host` header is also copied, and thus not
re-created by Guzzle with the server URL. In the backend, cURL sees it
and takes it into account, overriding passed URL silently.

This causes requests with empty host being fired by Guzzle, which is
kind of annoying :smiley:.

Christophe Coevoet.message:
Fix the upload of the code coverage to Scrutinizer

PHP 7 and HHVM are not able to generate code coverage on Travis. If
ocular is called in this case, it will report to Scrutinizer that the
code coverage has not been collected, which will cancel the scrutinizer
analysis if it is the first Travis job to finish (which is likely as
generating code coverage would slow down the other jobs).
Use the HttpFoundation API to read the header in the test kernel

Run Sphinx in strict mode on Travis

Sphinx warnings should make the doc build fail on Travis.

Merge pull request #91 from FriendsOfSymfony/purge-clarification

explain why we also purge in vcl_miss

Restricted the Travis builds to some branches only

We don't want Travis to build feature branches created in the main repos, as these feature branches will always have a PR which is built as well.
Travis will now run builds only for the master branch and for branches named "x.y" where x and y are numbers (to let us create maintenance branches for releases if needed), and for pull requests sent to these branches.

Jérôme Vieilledent.message:
Fix Host header for proxy client requests

When using `ban` requests with Varnish proxy client, requests are queued
and sent with `flush()`. Queued requests are registered without host,
making Guzzle create an empty `Host` header.

When flushing, Guzzle request is re-created starting
with the original one (so without host), with all registered headers.
The problem is that the empty `Host` header is also copied, and thus not
re-created by Guzzle with the server URL. In the backend, cURL sees it
and takes it into account, overriding passed URL silently.

This causes requests with empty host being fired by Guzzle, which is
kind of annoying :smiley:.

jnonon.message: Fixed bug that allows override necessary options

Changes:

* Added missing typehint
* Added return values when cUrl errors occurs
* Modified composer definition

Changes:

* Removed DependencyNotMetException in favor of RuntimeException
* Varnish helper now uses a single curl handler per request.
Fixed code conventions

David de Boer.message:
Remove Interface suffix and rename proxy client interfaces

* Apply fixes from StyleCI (#337)
* Update changelog
Fix libjemalloc1 build failure (#334)
Merge branch '1.4'
Prepare release 2.0.0 (#329)
Update links to ReadtheDocs
Fix spelling errors
Fix some small documentation issues

Simplify hits counting

With Varnish 4.0, the simple obj.hits stopped working and we had to
resort to counting the number of spaces in X-Varnish. At least from
Varnish 4.0.3 onwards, obj.hits works as it did in Varnish 3.
Test against PHP 7.1

Add Varnish 5 compatibility

* Make VCL compatible with Varnish 5.
* Move Varnish 4/5 files to varnish.
* Keep varnish-3 for now.
* Upgrade Travis config to Trusty/edge to get rid of
   /usr/lib/varnish/libvarnish.so: undefined symbol: pcre_free_study
* Update documentation.
* Update changelog.

Merge pull request #320 from FriendsOfSymfony/remove-test-duplication

extract shared assertions into traits
Add tagResponse method
Set correct minimum versions for --prefer-lowest
Add Puli dependency for php-http/discovery

Drop PHP 5.4 support

Fix Symfony 2.3-incompatible calls
Improve wording in docs
Move mock client to php-http/mock-client
Fix Travis failure due to timing issue
Merge branch '1.4'
Replace 'Symfony2' with 'Symfony'
Upgrade Symfony dependencies to 3.0
Clean up SymfonyTest (fix #254)
Fix HHVM build setup

Merge pull request #233 from FriendsOfSymfony/httpcache-trait

Provide Symfony HttpCache as trait

Provide test functionality in traits

Fix #202.

separate http client from trait

Make property and methods private

Add traits to docs

Reduce levels of inheritance

Merge pull request #214 from FriendsOfSymfony/custom-ttl

Symfony HttpCache listener for custom ttl header

Merge pull request #229 from zghosts/feature/vcl

extract vcl into a reusable set of subroutines

Merge pull request #227 from FriendsOfSymfony/short-array-syntax

Use short array syntax

Use short array syntax

Just because we can. :)
Specify minimum PHPUnit version

Move WebServerListener

Fix #206.

Merge pull request #219 from FriendsOfSymfony/improve-invalidate-doc

update phpdoc for TagHandler::invalidateTags

Remove deprecations

* Remove deprecated methods
* Update docs
* Switch to PHP 5.4+ array syntax
Change default Varnish version to 4

Use php-http/adapter for HTTP client abstraction

Remove custom adapters

Update to PSR-7, Guzzle 6 and php-http/adapter

Remove PHP 5.3 from build matrix

Adopt changes in http-adapter and use discovery

Remove dependencies on Guzzle (components)

We use Guzzle 6 for testing, so it needs to stay in require-dev.

Use php-http/message-decorator

Change branch alias to 2.0.x

Add docs

Allow failures on hhvm

Fix connection timing issues

Remove all Guzzle-specifics from the tests, too

Change documentation links to stable

Try to run HHVM on Guzzle 5

Remove Bash file

Add version notice to docs

Fix setPurgeLocation docs

Don't mock exceptions

* It’s easier not to
* Mocking exceptions causes HHVM to fail with "Call to a member function
  mockery_getName() on a non-object (NULL)"

Extract createUri() method

Remove allow_failures for HHVM

Add response code to cache hit/miss assertion message

Throw exceptions for error status codes
Add .editorconfig

Set Scrutinizer external coverage timeout

See https://github.com/FriendsOfSymfony/FOSHttpCacheBundle/pull/216.

Merge pull request #211 from FriendsOfSymfony/tests-autoload-dev

Autoload Tests only in dev
Autoload tests/ only in dev
Update changelog

Merge pull request #205 from FriendsOfSymfony/document-symfony-test-case

Christophe Coevoet.message:
Fix the upload of the code coverage to Scrutinizer

PHP 7 and HHVM are not able to generate code coverage on Travis. If
ocular is called in this case, it will report to Scrutinizer that the
code coverage has not been collected, which will cancel the scrutinizer
analysis if it is the first Travis job to finish (which is likely as
generating code coverage would slow down the other jobs).

We don't want Travis to build feature branches created in the main repos, as these feature branches will always have a PR which is built as well.
Travis will now run builds only for the master branch and for branches named "x.y" where x and y are numbers (to let us create maintenance branches for releases if needed), and for pull requests sent to these branches.

Jérôme Vieilledent.message:
Fix Host header for proxy client requests

When using `ban` requests with Varnish proxy client, requests are queued
and sent with `flush()`. Queued requests are registered without host,
making Guzzle create an empty `Host` header.

When flushing, Guzzle request is re-created starting
with the original one (so without host), with all registered headers.
The problem is that the empty `Host` header is also copied, and thus not
re-created by Guzzle with the server URL. In the backend, cURL sees it
and takes it into account, overriding passed URL silently.

This causes requests with empty host being fired by Guzzle, which is
kind of annoying :smiley:.

Christophe Coevoet.message:
Fix the upload of the code coverage to Scrutinizer

PHP 7 and HHVM are not able to generate code coverage on Travis. If
ocular is called in this case, it will report to Scrutinizer that the
code coverage has not been collected, which will cancel the scrutinizer
analysis if it is the first Travis job to finish (which is likely as
generating code coverage would slow down the other jobs).
Use the HttpFoundation API to read the header in the test kernel

Run Sphinx in strict mode on Travis

Sphinx warnings should make the doc build fail on Travis.

Merge pull request #91 from FriendsOfSymfony/purge-clarification

Restricted the Travis builds to some branches only

We don't want Travis to build feature branches created in the main repos, as these feature branches will always have a PR which is built as well.
Travis will now run builds only for the master branch and for branches named "x.y" where x and y are numbers (to let us create maintenance branches for releases if needed), and for pull requests sent to these branches.

Jérôme Vieilledent.message:
Fix Host header for proxy client requests

When using `ban` requests with Varnish proxy client, requests are queued
and sent with `flush()`. Queued requests are registered without host,
making Guzzle create an empty `Host` header.

When flushing, Guzzle request is re-created starting
with the original one (so without host), with all registered headers.
The problem is that the empty `Host` header is also copied, and thus not
re-created by Guzzle with the server URL. In the backend, cURL sees it
and takes it into account, overriding passed URL silently.

This causes requests with empty host being fired by Guzzle, which is
kind of annoying :smiley:.
